title: Book 3 - Pre-Intermediate Level

words.meaning: to succeed in doing something difficult
words.example: She achieved her goal of becoming a doctor.

words.meaning: to change behavior to suit new conditions
words.example: It took time to adapt to the new school.

words.meaning: to respect and approve of someone
words.example: I admire her courage and determination.

words.meaning: to move forward or make progress
words.example: Technology continues to advance rapidly.

words.meaning: something that helps you succeed
words.example: Speaking English gives you an advantage in business.

words.meaning: an exciting and dangerous journey
words.example: We went on an adventure in the mountains.

words.meaning: to have an influence on something
words.example: The weather affects my mood.

words.meaning: to have the same opinion as someone
words.example: I agree with your decision.

words.meaning: to give permission for something
words.example: My parents allow me to stay out late.

words.meaning: to surprise someone very much
words.example: The magician's tricks amazed the audience.

words.meaning: to examine something carefully
words.example: Scientists analyze the data from experiments.

words.meaning: to tell people about something officially
words.example: The company announced its new product.

words.meaning: to become visible or noticeable
words.example: The sun appeared from behind the clouds.

words.meaning: to put something on a surface
words.example: Apply sunscreen before going outside.

words.meaning: to come near to something
words.example: The train approached the station slowly.

words.meaning: to officially agree to something
words.example: The committee approved the new budget.

words.meaning: to disagree with someone angrily
words.example: They argued about politics for hours.

words.meaning: to organize or plan something
words.example: I'll arrange a meeting for next week.

words.meaning: to think something is true without proof
words.example: Don't assume everyone knows the rules.

words.meaning: to be present at an event
words.example: Many people attended the concert.

description: Pre-intermediate level English vocabulary with more complex words and expressions.
